title: ICML_2016_11_abs

sentences.text: The robust principal component analysis -LRB- robust PCA -RRB- problem has been considered in many machine learning applications , where the goal is to decompose the data matrix to a low rank part plus a sparse residual .

While current approaches are developed by only considering the low rank plus sparse structure , in many applications , side information of row and/or column entities may also be given , and it is still unclear to what extent could such information help robust PCA .
Thus , in this paper , we study the problem of robust PCA with side information , where both prior structure and features of entities are exploited for recovery .
We propose a convex problem to incorporate side information in robust PCA and show that the low rank matrix can be exactly recovered via the proposed method under certain conditions .
In particular , our guarantee suggests that a substantial amount of low rank matrices , which can not be recovered by standard robust PCA , become re-coverable by our proposed method .
The result theoretically justifies the effectiveness of features in robust PCA .

In addition , we conduct synthetic experiments as well as a real application on noisy image classification to show that our method also improves the performance in practice by exploiting side information .

summary: The robust principal component analysis -LRB- robust PCA -RRB- problem has been considered in many machine learning applications , where the goal is to decompose the data matrix to a low rank part plus a sparse residual . While current approaches are developed by only considering the low rank plus sparse structure , in many applications , side information of row and/or column entities may also be given , and it is still unclear to what extent could such information help robust PCA . Thus , in this paper , we study the problem of robust PCA with side information , where both prior structure and features of entities are exploited for recovery . We propose a convex problem to incorporate side information in robust PCA and show that the low rank matrix can be exactly recovered via the proposed method under certain conditions . In particular , our guarantee suggests that a substantial amount of low rank matrices , which can not be recovered by standard robust PCA , become re-coverable by our proposed method . The result theoretically justifies the effectiveness of features in robust PCA . In addition , we conduct synthetic experiments as well as a real application on noisy image classification to show that our method also improves the performance in practice by exploiting side information .

Predicate-has_been_considered_in_many_ma.label: has been considered in many machine learning applications
Predicate-has_been_considered_in_many_ma.description: This predicate indicates that a concept or technique (subject) has been explored and utilized as part of various approaches or methods within the field of machine learning (object), suggesting its relevance, importance, and potential applicability in different contexts.

Predicate-are_developed_by_only_consider.label: are developed by only considering
Predicate-are_developed_by_only_consider.description: This predicate indicates that a concept or approach (subject) has been created or formed solely based on consideration of specific factors or aspects (object), without taking into account other variables, influences, or perspectives. The subject's development is directly attributed to the object, implying a deliberate and intentional focus.

Predicate-may_also_be_given.label: may also be given
Predicate-may_also_be_given.description: Indicates that an additional piece of information or context can be provided to supplement or clarify the subject. This predicate suggests a relationship where the object provides supplementary details, insights, or perspectives that enhance our understanding of the subject.

Predicate-are_developed_by.label: are developed by
Predicate-are_developed_by.description: Indicates that a concept or method (subject) has been created or produced through a specific process or approach (object), highlighting the agency and responsibility behind its development.

Predicate-study.label: study
Predicate-study.description: To engage in a systematic investigation or examination of the object, often involving critical analysis, interpretation, and/or experimentation to gain understanding, insight, or knowledge.

Predicate-propose.label: propose
Predicate-propose.description: To suggest or put forward an idea, plan, or proposal for consideration and potential implementation.

Predicate-suggests_that_a_substantial_am.label: suggests that a substantial amount of
Predicate-suggests_that_a_substantial_am.description: The predicate 'suggests that a substantial amount of' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject implies or proposes that there exists a significant quantity of something described by the object. This suggests a connection between the subject's guarantee or promise and the existence or potential for a large number of instances matching the description in the object.

Predicate-cannot_recover_by.label: cannot recover by
Predicate-cannot_recover_by.description: The predicate 'cannot recover by' indicates that there exists an obstacle or limitation that prevents the subject from achieving a certain level of recovery, restoration, or improvement with respect to the object. In general, it suggests that the subject's ability to recover or improve is hindered or blocked in some way due to the presence of the object.

Predicate-become_re-coverable_by.label: become re-coverable by
Predicate-become_re-coverable_by.description: The predicate 'become re-coverable by' indicates a transformation or improvement process where something (the subject) gains the ability to be recovered or restored through some means or mechanism (the object). This relationship suggests that the subject's recoverability was previously compromised, but is now enhanced or restored due to the influence of the object.

Predicate-justifies.label: justifies
Predicate-justifies.description: To justify means to provide a logical or rational explanation for something's existence, validity, or correctness. In this sense, it connects the subject (the result) with the object (the effectiveness of features in robust PCA), indicating that the outcome or consequence of some process is logically sound and supports the value or importance of those features.

Predicate-show_that.label: show that
Predicate-show_that.description: To demonstrate or prove something through evidence, argumentation, or demonstration. The predicate 'show that' indicates a connection between the subject (the method or approach used to demonstrate) and the object (what is being demonstrated), implying a sense of validation, confirmation, or justification.

Predicate-in_this_paper_we_propose.label: in this paper, we propose
Predicate-in_this_paper_we_propose.description: This predicate indicates that a new idea or approach will be presented in this paper. It serves as an introduction to the main contribution, connecting the subject (the authors) with their proposed solution or methodology.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept or idea encompasses or includes the object as a more general category. It suggests a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject represents a higher-level abstraction and the object represents a specific instance or subcategory within it.
